html:
Woe. Isaiah pronounces distress upon Jerusalem, resulting from God's judgments.

Ariel. The city of Jerusalem. Ariel appears five times in the Old Testament, all in Isa. 29. The word is commonly translated as "lion of God," "lioness of God," or "altar-hearth" of God. The lion is a symbol of Judah (Gen. 49:9).

add year to year/kill sacrifices. Elder Orson Pratt explained, "After the Messiah came and was sacrificed for the sins of the world, the Jews continued to 'kill sacrifices,' when they should have been done away; they added 'year to year' to the laws of Moses."
